p: There is considerable interannual variability in the GMSL time series due to changes in TWS, mainly driven by El Niño Southern Oscillation (ENSO) effects ( 7 – 9). We use a multivariable empirical orthogonal function (EOF) analysis to isolate the ENSO effects ( Fig. 2) and remove them from the GMSL curve. This reduces the GMSL acceleration estimate by 0.033 mm/y 2, resulting in a final “climate-change–driven” acceleration of 0.084 mm/y 2. Climate-change–driven in this case means we have tried to adjust the GMSL measurements for as many natural interannual and decadal effects as we can to try to isolate the longer-term, potentially anthropogenic, acceleration––any remaining effects are considered in the error analysis.
